g.text: Deﬁnes the structure and content of
each hotspot. This is the primary data
parsed by the frontend. It governs all
Refer to the mini purple callout boxes for a breakdown of which ﬁelds power each ﬂow.
for automatically generated share overrides. It
determines what kind of access is granted when a user shares a hotspot or journey link —
depending on user type, sharing method, and global rules.
— it governs how the system behaves when
• If shared_link_unlocks_image = true, then any narration/overlay/About access via a shared link
also makes the full piece image visible — even if normally gated.
• max_uses_preview : number (max uses for preview-level shares (typically null/unlimited))
• max_uses_full_access : number (Max uses for full access shares (e.g. 1 for supporters))
All hotspot ﬁelds from the JSON ﬁle — referenced
across all UI and access layers
Live backend rules injected at runtime
users share a hotspot or journey. It controls access to narration,
Preview and full access behavior (e.g. time limits, usage caps)
are controlled by global sharing settings.
• A journey is shared via email campaign or UI
• A developer-triggered ﬂow adds an override entry for testing or
, usage limits, and origin (e.g. email, user-share,
• max_uses (injected from global defaults — varies by preview/full
• Supporters may be granted more powerful share privileges (e.g.
full access shares vs preview access shares )
• Non-supporters (email-gated or free users) may be limited to
• Overrides apply per-hotspot and do not unlock access to other
Stores journey-level temporary access rules triggered by shared
Journey links. These apply to multiple hotspots at once and are
distinct from single-hotspot share links.. Each journey can deﬁne:
• Whether it grants access to just one hotspot or the entire
These two nodes trigger the full access logic
Triggered when user hovers or taps on a hotspot.
Accepts highlight hotspot via query string
On activation, the target piece loads fully, then
zooms smoothly into the highlighted hotspot to
focus the user.. without triggering box 3
Shows visual feedback (highlight, click FX) and triggers button display rules on desktop
hover. On mobile, this logic is skipped and button display is handled inside the player
• (*Same applies for _on_click variants for mobile fallback)
This box only handles what is visually shown.
It does not determine whether the user has access to gated content like narration,
overlay images, or the About text.
Triggers “Show [X]” buttons or reveals overlays after user taps/clicks on hotspot. This
logic complements Box 4 (hover behavior) and is used on touch devices or desktop
• (Silent mode about button: check about_button_silent_mode gating separately)
This box only handles what is visually shown.
It does not determine whether the user has access to gated content like narration,
overlay images, or the About text.
Handles image overlay behavior triggered by hover (desktop only).
• Depending on the images_display_mode, this either:
• Reveals the image overlay immediately, or
• Displaying the button is always allowed if the display mode is triggered.
• Access is only enforced when the user clicks the About button to reveal the panel.
Handles the display of the “Show Links” button triggered by hover on desktop.
This does not control link access — links are always free — but determines when
Controls visibility and gating behavior for the “About” button when hovered on desktop.
There are two separate conﬁguration ﬁelds for About behaviour:
• about_button_display_mode: applies when user is listening to narration (interactive
• about_button_silent_mode: applies when piece is in silent mode (no narration
In most cases, the button is shown for silent mode reading — this schema clearly
Displaying the button is always allowed if the display mode is triggered.
Access is only enforced when the user clicks the About button to reveal the panel.
show About button (visible in interactive mode)
• Clicking the button will trigger access check (about_access or narration_access
Handles image overlay behaviour triggered by click or tap - used on desktop (click)
Depending on the images_display_mode, this either:
• Revealing the overlay directly (auto_display_on_click) requires access validation -
the system will check if the user is allowed to see it.
• Showing the button is always allowed - gating occurs when the user clicks the
button, not when it is displayed.

g.serif:id: 5e: LINKS BUTTON UI PATH - (CLICK/TAP TRIGGERS ONLY)

g.text: Controls when the “Show Links” button appears after click or tap. This path applies
Links are always free to open.

g.serif:id: 5f: ABOUT BUTTON UI PATH (CLICK/TAP TRIGGERS ONLY

g.text: Handles the display and gating behavior of the “About” button on mobile (or desktop
It separates logic into two distinct conﬁgurations:
• about_button_display_mode: active when narration is playing
• about_button_silent_mode: active when piece is in silent mode
This allows diﬀerent behavior depending on whether the piece is being experienced
as an audiobook or silently browsed
Displaying the button is always allowed if the display mode is triggered.
Access is only enforced when the user clicks the About button to reveal the panel.
Central engine for evaluating user access to narration,
Includes standard hotspot logic, shared link overrides, and
Determines whether a user has access to narration, overlay, or About content —
based on their session state, gating rules, and any override logic from links or
This is the central decision point for all gating logic. It handles standard interactions
(hotspot clicks), deep links, and journeys — evaluating if content should be played
immediately, gated temporarily (preview), or fully gated behind email/subscription.

g.serif:id: 6a. Access Control — Standard Hotspot Interaction (Branch A)

g.text: Handles access checks when a user clicks or taps on a hotspot.
• If narration_access = supporter or or overlay_access/about_access
• Else if narration_access = gated or overlay_access/about_access
If narration_access = supporter or or overlay_access/about_access
Access rules are inherited from per-piece defaults in the Gallery
access) unless overridden at the hotspot level in the Hotspot

g.serif:id: 6b. Access Control - Deep Link Access and Override Evaluation (Branch B))

g.text: Evaluates temporary override access triggered by shared hotspot
• If override exists in Dynamic Override Sheet:

g.serif:id: 6b. Access Control - Deep Link Access and Override Evaluation (Branch B))

g.text: Handles deep links to journeys with gated access rules.
Route to Box 9 (preview) then Box 7 (email veriﬁcation)
Also active in phase 2 for users accessing gated content
Handles email veriﬁcation checks for gated content.
prompts user with Magic Link and resumes
(As illustrated in the Access Gating Flow chart.)
prompts upgrade and resumes playback after
(As illustrated in the Access Gating Flow chart.)
by an override link — typically from a shared
This preview lets new users experience a
eventually prompts for veriﬁcation to continue.
• Applies only if override is active and user is
• Duration is deﬁned globally or per content
• After the preview, standard gating resumes
Also grants full piece image access if
• Access rules are enforced after time limit
Veriﬁed users skip this step entirely
share link, the base image for
the piece is also made viewable
Plays narration audio once access is granted. Includes
player UI controls (pause, rewind, highlight mode).
Uses overlay_display_mode to determine UI layout
Reveals the description (about_text) if access is granted
or if it is not gated.
: Never gated. Opens immediately in a popup
Internal link route directly to hotspot logic (Box 3 or 13),
if narration/overlay/about = gated → prompt email veriﬁcation
if narration/overlay/about = supporter_only → check subscription status
check about access via 6A (free / gated / supporter)
if narration/overlay/about access = free → grant access immediately
on “Links” button click → open external URL (always free)
on “Links” button click → open internal link (same piece/
on “Links” button click → open internal link (same piece/
if deep link = hotspot → check override DB for temp access → apply global defaults if none found
if deep link = journey → check journey access rules → grant temp access for included hotspots

Deﬁnes interactive logic, access gating, and override behaviour across mobile/desktop —
(for Diary of Deji Interactive Art Pieces)
Entry point determines access logic: gallery paths check access at
piece level; deep links check at hotspot level. This schema shows what
